column4: Could anyone help me troubleshoot booting issues i am having with xp. I reformated my ubuntu feisty install to a hardy one today and on reboot i couldn't boot into either OS because grub had the wrong menu items in it. I finally managed to boot into ubuntu now, but when i try to boot where i think xp is installed it just hangs. Other partitions i've tryed for xp give the "no ntldr" error on grub.
do you have more than one harddrive?
yes
it has the map hd(1) hd(0) and map hd(0) hd(1) done
ok, that's what I was thinking of
any other thoughts on the situation? It displays the starting up message and then just hangs there
would it help if i pasted the grub menu.lst lines for xp?
ok
root (hd0,1)     savedefault     makeactive     map (hd0) (hd1)    map (hd1) (hd0)     chainloader +1
root(hd0,1) is the only one that would even attempt to boot
try: rootgrub> root (hd1,0)
grub> chainloader +1
grub> map (hd0) (hd1)
try:  root (hd1,0)  chainloader +1  map  (hd0) (hd1)    map (hd1) (hd0)
you mean insert those lines into the menu.lst?
yes, or try it manually in grub, by editing the menu
I tried some different combinations and then it worked :)
you're a miracle man, windows is booting now. Would you mind telling me what was wrong for future reference?
heh, I'm not sure
I looked here for reference: http://www.gnu.org/software/grub/grub-legacy-faq.en.html#q10
anyway, thank you, it's working great now:)
cool
